item.title: Bessent tried to dissuade Trump from firing Powell: WSJ
item.description: Jerome Powell has long been a target of President Donald Trump, who has repeatedly criticized the Fed chair for not cutting interest rates.

item.title: Trump says releasing Epstein files wouldn’t satisfy ‘troublemakers,’ as pressure mounts
item.description: Trump's post comes after the Justice Department asked federal judges to unseal the grand jury testimonies in the criminal case of Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: EPA eliminates research and development office, begins layoffs
item.description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced it is eliminating its research and development arm and reducing agency staff by thousands of employees.

item.title: Donald Trump's lawsuit against Bob Woodward over audiobook is dismissed
item.description: The decision is a victory for Woodward, his publisher, Simon & Schuster, and its former owner, Paramount Global.

item.title: Trump sues Murdoch for $10 billion over WSJ story on Epstein birthday letter
item.description: President Trump is under increasing pressure to have the Justice Department release files about the late pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.
